main event: A silver metallic disc-shaped object with a bright light below was observed over Wooddale, Illinois on August 27, 1955. The object appeared to increase and decrease in brightness and made a jet-like sound.
interesting points: The object was discernible in size and appeared to be at the same altitude as the observer.
The object moved straight away in a level flight path and faded away over the course of 2-3 seconds.
The object was observed for a total of 7 minutes before disappearing.
The weather conditions were clear with minimal cloud cover and excellent visibility.
Winds at various altitudes were measured between 35-280 knots.
sighted object: silver metallic disc with bright light below
